title: Barbara Windsor makes rare public appearance with Matt Lucas
text:
Barbara Windsor enjoys evening with Matt Lucas (Picture: Matt Lucas/Twitter)

Barbara Windsor has enjoyed an evening with Matt Lucas as she watched him perform in Les Miserables.

The former EastEnders star dropped by the Gielgud Theatre, in London, where she managed to spend time with the comedian – who has reprised his role of Thénardier.

Posing for a selfie backstage, the pair were joined by the likes of Alfie Boe, who has taken the lead in the production as Jean Valjean.

And it seems they were all in high spirits, as the trio beamed down the camera lens.

Writing alongside the snap, the Little Britain star said: ‘Another day, another superstar in the audience at Les Mis!’

The pair hung out with Alfie backstage (Picture: Matt Lucas/Twitter)

Barbara was diagnosed with Alzheimer’s disease in 2014, however that hasn’t stopped her from hanging out with her celebrity pals.

And fans couldn’t get over how great she looked, as they were quick to comment on the post.

‘Barbara looks amazing so happy to see her out and about,’ one wrote, while another added: ‘Babs looks amazing.’

Someone else said: ‘What an amazing picture and certainly one for you all to treasure.’

Barbara’s husband Scott Mitchell recently spoke out about life as a carer (Picture: Getty Images)

The actress has been supported by her husband Scott Mitchell, who recently spoke to Metro.co.uk about his life as a carer.

Ahead of the Best Heroes Awards, in London, he told us: ‘I think as a carer you learn to adapt to a different way of life, that’s what you do.

‘I do have carers who come in, which means I can go and do my work and I can do whatever I need to do – whether that’s going for lunch, go and meet friends for a coffee, go and do some shopping.’

The star added: ‘It’s essential for people caring for someone to get that little bit of respite.

‘I found that very difficult to do at first. I felt very guilty about it, I felt like I shouldn’t be leaving her.’
